result.execSummary:
The defendant Tyler W Horbinski was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Reckless Driving-Cause Great Bodily Harm, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.62(4).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Credit For Time Served 0 Days.
Defendant IS NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration NOR the Substance Abuse Program.

miscConds.notes:
Cost and Surcharge to be paid as a Condition of Probation during the First 12 months.

If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.
Mental Health Evaluation and follow through with any treatment recommended.

Expunction is conditionally granted in 5 years upon completion of sentence, payment of all costs/fees and no new criminal law violations.  Defendant must Petition the Court in writing upon successful completion of the sentence.

Maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Submit Random Urine Screens.
No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions.
Sign any/all Medical Releases for Agent.
Operate a motor vehicle with a valid driver's license.
Submit a written apology to the victim.
No contact with victim or family members other than the letter of apology.
Provide DNA Sample If not yet provided and Pay Surcharge.
Restitution:  $415.50 to the Village of Eagle - Already Paid.

timeConds.notes: Condition Time:  90 Days Huber - Non-working hours with standard release conditions - can be served in Winnebago County only if served in the Institution.  To commence forthwith.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea
